action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: I will start with a common five-letter word that includes a variety of vowels and consonants to gather as much information as possible.
guess: audio

attempts = 1
target_word = viper
guess = audio
guess_feedback = a<red> u<red> d<red> i<yellow> o<red>

guess_feedback: a<red> u<red> d<red> i<yellow> o<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "i" is in the word but in the wrong position. I will try to place it in a different position and use other common consonants and vowels to gather more information.
guess: bingo

attempts = 2
target_word = viper
guess = bingo
guess_feedback = b<red> i<green> n<red> g<red> o<red>

guess_feedback: b<red> i<green> n<red> g<red> o<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "i" is in the correct position. I will keep "i" in the same position and try different letters for the remaining positions.
guess: witty

attempts = 3
target_word = viper
guess = witty
guess_feedback = w<red> i<green> t<red> t<red> y<red>

guess_feedback: w<red> i<green> t<red> t<red> y<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "i" is confirmed in the second position. I will keep "i" in the same position and try different letters for the remaining positions, avoiding previously incorrect letters.
guess: dingo

attempts = 4
target_word = viper
guess = dingo
guess_feedback = d<red> i<green> n<red> g<red> o<red>

guess_feedback: d<red> i<green> n<red> g<red> o<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "d", "n", "g", and "o" are not in the word. I will try a new set of letters, keeping "i" in the second position.
guess: pique

attempts = 5
target_word = viper
guess = pique
guess_feedback = p<yellow> i<green> q<red> u<red> e<yellow>

guess_feedback: p<yellow> i<green> q<red> u<red> e<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "p" and "e" are in the word but in the wrong positions. "q" and "u" are not in the word. I will try to place "p" and "e" in different positions while keeping "i" in the second position.
guess: piece

attempts = 6
target_word = viper
guess = piece
guess_feedback = p<yellow> i<green> e<yellow> c<red> e<red>

guess_explanation: I will start with a common five-letter word that includes a variety of vowels and consonants to gather as much information as possible.
The letter "i" is in the word but in the wrong position. I will try to place it in a different position and use other common consonants and vowels to gather more information.
The letter "i" is in the correct position. I will keep "i" in the same position and try different letters for the remaining positions.
The letter "i" is confirmed in the second position. I will keep "i" in the same position and try different letters for the remaining positions, avoiding previously incorrect letters.
The letters "d", "n", "g", and "o" are not in the word. I will try a new set of letters, keeping "i" in the second position.
The letters "p" and "e" are in the word but in the wrong positions. "q" and "u" are not in the word. I will try to place "p" and "e" in different positions while keeping "i" in the second position.
